newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentina to issue five-year Bontes late April.
newsitem.headline: Argentina to issue five-year Bontes late April.

text.p: Argentina will issue between $500 million and $750 million in five-year Bonte Treasury bonds at the end of April, Finance Undersecretary Miguel Kiguel said Tuesday.
"It will be the second placement of the year. We're studying whether to issue $500 or $750 million...with a five-year maturity," Kiguel told reporters.
He said Argentina would return to the international credit markets "within one or two weeks...when market conditions are calmer."
Kiguel also said he was "optimistic" about the possibility of an upgrade in Argentina's sovereign debt rating in the near future.
Standard & Poors said earlier this month it had brought Argentine debt under review for a possible upgrade from its current BB- status in the first days of April.
